Specimen Type: Urethral swab, cervical swab, or urine
Purpose: To detect Mycoplasma genitalium DNA in clinical specimens for accurate diagnosis of infection.
Container: Sterile microcentrifuge tubes (1.5 mL or 0.2 mL) or appropriate swab/urine collection container
Equipment: PCR thermocycler, microcentrifuge, vortex mixer, pipettes with tips, nucleic acid extraction kit, real-time PCR system
